item.title: 西门子出让医疗业务部门西门子医疗集团 2% 的股份

item.title: 日本央行的鹰派立场有望刺激对美国企业债券的需求
item.description: 据美国银行（Bank of America Corp）称，日本央行的加息应有助于降低日本投资者的货币保护成本，刺激他们对美国投资级公司债券的兴趣。【原文：Interest rate hikes from the Bank of Japan should help cut currency protection costs for Japanese investors, spurring their appetite for US investment-grade corporate bonds, according to Bank of America Corp.】

item.title: 特朗普的政策洪流导致石油市场瘫痪
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普再次成为美国总统后，石油市场对他试图做出的一系列改变越来越麻木。【原文：The oil market is becoming increasingly numb to the array of changes that Donald Trump is trying to make now that he’s US President again.】

item.title: SolarEdge 攀升 40%，收入超预期引发空头回补
item.description: 太阳能设备制造商 SolarEdge Technologies Inc. 的销售额超过预期，引发明显的空头回补反弹，盘中涨幅高达 40%，创下历史最大涨幅。【原文：SolarEdge Technologies Inc. soared as much as 40% for the biggest intraday gain on record after the solar-equipment maker surpassed sales forecasts, triggering an apparent short-covering rally.】

item.description: 瑞士的目标是在明年初与欧盟签署一项协议，以确保瑞士能够进入欧盟单一市场，而可能举行的公民投票仍迫在眉睫。【原文：Switzerland aims to sign a deal with the European Union to secure its access to the bloc’s single market early next year, with a possible plebiscite still looming.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴因看好人工智能而实现 1,100 亿美元的增长面临盈利考验
item.description: 阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司（Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.）在 DeepSeek 引发的涨势为其市值增加超过 1100 亿美元后，将在周四的财报中面临关键考验。【原文：Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. faces a key test in its earnings presentation Thursday after a DeepSeek-sparked rally added more than $110 billion to its market value.】

item.title: 微软发布面向未来数据中心的量子计算芯片
item.description: 微软公司（Microsoft Corp.）发布了其首款量子计算芯片，这是该公司在努力生产有朝一日可能解决现代计算机所无法解决的问题的设备方面迈出的重要一步。【原文：Microsoft Corp. announced its first quantum computing chip, a major step in the company’s effort to produce devices that might someday solve problems beyond the reach of modern computers.】

item.title: Binance.US 恢复通过银行转账在平台上使用美元
item.description: Binance.US表示，其客户很快就能在该加密货币交易所存取美元，这是近两年来的第一次。【原文：Binance.US said its customers will soon be able to deposit and withdraw US dollars on the crypto exchange for the first time in almost two years.】

item.title: 纽约市最精英的私立高中今年秋季的学费将接近 7 万美元
item.description: 曼哈顿精英私立学校的学费正逐步接近 7 万美元这一惊人的里程碑。【原文：The cost of Manhattan’s elite private schools is edging closer to a staggering milestone of $70,000.】

item.title: KKR 据称将出价 40 亿英镑入股泰晤士水务公司
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，KKR & Co.提出向泰晤士水务公司注资近 40 亿英镑（50 亿美元），以获得这家陷入困境的公用事业公司的多数股权。【原文：KKR & Co. offered to inject nearly £4 billion ($5 billion) into Thames Water for a majority stake in the beleaguered utility, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国吸引力与日俱增，欧洲和亚洲面临 1300 亿美元的上市潮
item.description: 欧洲和亚洲的公司可能很快就会在美国市场上市，因为更高的估值和更充裕的流动性会促使它们从本国市场撤离。【原文：European and Asian firms may soon flood the US market with new listings, as the allure of loftier valuations and deeper liquidity fuels an exodus from their home markets.】

item.title: 印度中央银行称印度经济增长步伐将加快
item.description: 印度储备银行在其月度公报中表示，印度经济已经恢复了失去的势头，在通胀放缓和税收减免的支持下，消费需求可能会有所改善。【原文：India’s economy has recovered its lost momentum and consumption demand may improve on the back of moderating inflation and tax relief, the Reserve Bank of India said in its monthly bulletin.】

item.title: 税收纠纷导致预算延迟，南非股市和兰特下跌
item.description: 在立法者推迟提交年度预算后，南非兰特和股市暴跌，引发了人们对自去年 5 月大选以来一直执政的联合政府稳定性的担忧。【原文：South Africa’s rand and stocks slumped after lawmakers delayed the presentation of the annual budget, raising concern about the stability of the coalition government that has governed the country since elections in May last year.】

item.title: 私募股权投资因试图剥夺投资者保护而遭到反击
item.description: 在 2025 年风起云涌的杠杆债务市场上，一切都有待商榷，但事实证明，三项投资者保护措施是贷款人不会逾越的底线。【原文：In 2025’s go-go leveraged debt markets, everything is up for negotiation, but a trio of investor protections are proving to be lines that lenders won’t cross.】

item.title: 欧盟将拨出专款保护海底电缆免遭破坏
item.description: 欧盟将加强对可能遭到破坏的数千英里海底电缆的资助和监控，以更好地保护集团的能源和数字安全。【原文：The European Union will boost funding and surveillance for thousands of miles of undersea cables at risk of sabotage, to better protect the bloc’s energy and digital security.】

item.title: 报告称，Uber、Lyft 因车费上涨 7.2% 而面临客户流失风险

item.title: 南非民主党警告增税计划将 "摧毁 "经济
item.description: 南非民主联盟（Democratic Alliance）为其阻挠一项出人意料的提高增值税计划的决定进行了辩护，该计划迫使年度预算的提交出现了前所未有的延迟。【原文：South Africa’s Democratic Alliance defended its decision to obstruct a surprise plan to hike value-added tax, forcing an unprecedented delay in the presentation of the annual budget.】

item.title: Gramercy 目标 10 亿美元用于土耳其私人信贷投资
item.description: Gramercy Funds Management 公司计划在未来 24 个月内完成 10 亿美元的土耳其私人信贷交易，这是该公司直接向新兴市场公司提供贷款战略的一部分。【原文：Gramercy Funds Management is planning to reach $1 billion in Turkish private-credit deals in the next 24 months as part of its strategy of lending directly to emerging-market companies.】

item.title: 特朗普媒体就封口令起诉巴西最高法院法官
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统的媒体公司起诉了巴西最高法院的一名法官，指控他试图非法压制巴西保守派声音在美国社交媒体上的活动。【原文：President Donald Trump’s media company sued a Brazilian Supreme Court justice, accusing him of trying to illegally suppress the US social-media activity of conservative Brazilian voices.】

item.title: 经济乐观情绪升温，阿根廷各省着眼于出售债务
item.description: 阿根廷的两个地区政府在阔别国际债券市场近十年后，正在探索重返国际债券市场，利用华尔街对阿根廷经济正在反弹、通货膨胀终于得到控制的信心。【原文：Two Argentine regional governments are exploring a return to international bond markets after a near decade-long absence, tapping into Wall Street confidence that the economy is rebounding and inflation is finally back under control.】

item.title: 美国房屋新开工量在 12 月大涨后广泛回落
item.description: 由于对抵押贷款利率和未售出房屋的担忧与日俱增，建筑商减少了单户和多户住宅的建设，美国 1 月份的房屋开工率有所放缓。【原文：US housing starts slowed in January as builders pulled back on single- and multifamily home construction amid growing worries over mortgage rates and unsold homes.】
